definition.name: GitHub Script
definition.description: Run simple scripts using the GitHub client
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: github-token
inputs.description: The GitHub token used to create an authenticated client

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Whether to tell the GitHub client to log details of its requests. true or false. Default is to run in debug mode when the GitHub Actions step debug logging is turned on.

inputs.name: previews
inputs.description: A comma-separated list of GraphQL API previews to accept

inputs.name: result-encoding
inputs.description: Either "string" or "json" (default "json")—how the result will be encoded

inputs.name: retries
inputs.description: The number of times to retry a request

inputs.name: retry-exempt-status-codes
inputs.description: A comma separated list of status codes that will NOT be retried e.g. "400,500". No effect unless `retries` is set

inputs.name: base-url
inputs.description: An optional GitHub REST API URL to connect to a different GitHub instance. For example, https://my.github-enterprise-server.com/api/v3

outputs.name: result
outputs.description: The return value of the script, stringified with `JSON.stringify`

evidence.reasoning: The GitHub Script action allows users to run scripts that interact with the GitHub API, which falls under infrastructure management. It also involves authentication through the GitHub token and can be used to enhance code quality by automating checks or processes.
